title: Twitter thread on deleting yourself from 99.9% of the web goes viral
text:
Deleting your entire online identity, in several not-so-easy steps (Getty Images)

Privacy is a big topic in 2019 as we all grapple with how much digital companies know about us.

But it turns out that if you want to wipe yourself from the internet, then there’s a lot of hard work involved.

One Twitter user posted an exhaustive thread on just what it takes to delete yourself from 99.9% of the web. Somewhat ironically, for a post abut deleting yourself from the digital world – it went viral.

At the time of writing, it has notched up nearly 90,000 retweets and well over 360,000 likes. Here it is in all its glory:

How to DELETE 99.9% of your digital footprint from the internet [a thread] — Liam 💻 (@somenerdliam) October 15, 2019

The user behind the tweet, a self-described ‘code monkey by day, twitter philosopher by night’ followed up his post with an explanation of why it went viral. Essentially, a difficult process has been broken down in an accessible way.

Putting it behind a paywall or initially presenting it as a service I provide would have taken away from the entire point. — Liam 💻 (@somenerdliam) October 16, 2019

Now if you want to follow his advice and delete yourself from the web, you know exactly how to do it. But be warned – there’s no going back.
